thread.title: 49ers release Shareece Wright; cornerback failed to play in regular-season game with team
thread.title_full: 49ers release Shareece Wright; cornerback failed to play in regular-season game with team

title: 49ers release Shareece Wright; cornerback failed to play in regular-season game with team
text:
49ers release Shareece Wright; cornerback failed to play in regular-season game with team THE ASSOCIATED PRESS  44  44   
People: 
California (1459) 
SANTA CLARA, California — The San Francisco 49ers have released cornerback Shareece Wright. He didn't appear in a game after a short stint with the team that began with him competing for a starting job. 
San Francisco (1-3) made the move Saturday ahead of Sunday night's road game against the New York Giants. Wright had yet to be active on the game-day roster. 
Wright is now looking to catch on with another team, and he thanked the 49ers on Twitter for granting his release. The 28-year-old Wright played his first four seasons with San Diego before signing a one-year deal as a free agent in March. 
The 49ers also promoted guard Andrew Tiller to the active roster from the practice squad to boost the offensive line. 
AP NFL website: http://www.pro32.ap.org and http://www.twitter.com/AP_NFL
